Package main.java.controller

Interface IFrameController

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    FrameController
    public interface IFrameController
    This interface represents the controller part of the MVC architecture of the application. It is responsible for handling the flow of the application. It is responsible for taking inputs from the user, and directs view to show output to the user. Once it receives input from user it can ask model for any validation or any processing that needs to be done in the application. This controller is specifically designed for the GUI interface.

    • Method Detail

      • getMenuItems

        java.util.List<java.lang.String> getMenuItems()
        It allows the controller to send in menu items to the view to show the operations that can be performed by the portfolio management system.
        Returns:
        List of menu items in string format

      • exitProgram

        void exitProgram()
        This method allows the controller to exit the application.

      • setView

        void setView​(IFrameView v)
        This method allows the controller to set the current view to start the program. Along with setting the start view it also to configure listeners for each button and actions performed upon clicking those buttons.
        Parameters:
        v - The view which needs to be set as the start view

      • portfolioNameChecker

        boolean portfolioNameChecker​(java.lang.String s)
        This method takes the string which can be a portfolio name and checks if the portfolio name is valid or not. This would allow controller to provide feedback to the view.
        Parameters:
        s - The candidate portfolio name that needs to checked.
        Returns:
        boolean on whether the portfolio name is valid.

      • checkNumberOfStocks

        boolean checkNumberOfStocks​(java.lang.String s)
        This method checks if the string entered is a valid number of stock, this would allow controller to provide feedback to the view.
        Parameters:
        s - The candidate string which may or may not be number of stocks
        Returns:
        boolean on which the number of stocks is valid or not
